document.masterDocTitle: The Paraonidae (Annelida: Sedentaria) from Norway and adjacent seas, with two new species, four new records, and a redescription of Paraonides nordica Strelzov, 1968 based on type material

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Paraonidae (Annelida: Sedentaria) from Norway and adjacent seas, with two new species, four new records, and a redescription of Paraonides nordica Strelzov, 1968 based on type material

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. 2290 Tromsøsundet S15; 69.6573°N – 18.8813°E ; 38 m ; 23.04.2002 ;
holotype
( ZMBN 116015), three
paratypes
( ZMBN 116016) and 26 specimens . 2876 Finnmark 592; 70.0650°N – 29.0663°E ; 88 m ; 13.09.2003 ; four
paratypes
( ZMBN 116017) and 16 specimens .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Paradoneis andreae
n. sp.
Holotype. A. Anterior end, lateral view; B. Right parapodium of chaetiger 10, anterior view; C. Left parapodium of chaetiger 69, anterior view; D. Left parapodium of chaetiger 110, anterior view; E. Forked notochaetae of chaetiger 27; F. Detail of spine-like neurochaeta and ventral capillary neurochaetae of chaetiger 110; G. Pygidium. Scale bar: A: 0.3 mm. B, C: 95 µm. E, D: 30 µm. G: 0.15 mm.

FIGURE 8.
Paradoneis andreae
n. sp.
SEM micrographs, specimen from 2290 Tromsøsundet. A. Anterior end, dorsolateral view. B. Detail of the same; C. Chaetigers 7 to 12, lateral view; D: Postbranchial chaetigers, lateral view; E: detail of posterior neuropodia showing capillary and spine-like neurocahetae. Abbreviations: br: branchia; cp: capillary chaeta; no: nuchal organ; npl: notopodial postchaetal organ; sl: spine-like neurochaeta. Scale bar: A: 0.3 mm; B: 50 µm; C: 0.1 mm; E: 20 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Within the genus
Paradoneis
only
P. eliasoni Mackie, 1991
, widely distributed through North Atlantic and also recorded in this work, and
P. strelzovi de León-González & Díaz-Castañeda, 2011
, from
Baja California
, bear single spine-like neurochaetae in posterior chaetigers and forked modified notochaetae ( Mackie 1991 ; Aguirrezabalaga & Gil 2009 ; de León-González & Díaz-Castañeda 2011 ). However, these two species bear fewer branchiae;
P. eliasoni
possesses up to 12 pairs ( Mackie 1991 ; Aguirrezabalaga & Gil 2009 ) and
P. strelzovi
has up to seven (de León-González & Díaz-Castañeda 2011 ). Apart of the number of branchiae,
P. strelzovi
can be told apart by the shape of the notopodial postchaetal lobes (almost papiliform in
P. andreae
n. sp.
, distinctly triangular in
P. strelzovi
) and the type of branchiae, which have ciliated outer margins in
P. andreae
n. sp.
and are smooth in
P. strelzovi (de León-González & Díaz-Castañeda 2011 )
.
Paradoneis eliasoni
also differs in the shape of the branchiae, which have ciliation both on outer and inner margins ( Aguirrezabalaga & Gil 2009 ).
Etymology. The new species is dedicated to Andrea, daughter of the first author.
